segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 38th verse of the 6th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on the glorification of Narada Muni and his role in relieving the suffering of souls.
segments.transcript: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet In this session, we'll be discussing from the last verse, the 38th verse of the 6th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. This is the real conclusion. In the previous session, I had intended to complete this chapter, but I could not. So, I'll be completing the chapter in this session. The 38th verse, Aho Devarashir Dhanayoyam Yat Keertim Sharang Dhanvanaha Gayan Madhyan Idam Tantraya Ramayatti Aturam Jagat The meaning of this verse is, All glory and success to Srila Narad Muni because he glorifies the activities of the personality of Godhead and so doing, he himself takes pleasure and also enlivens all the distressed souls of the universe.

segments.key_quote: He is travelling everywhere to relieve the distress of those suffering souls who are conditioned souls in this world under the influence of illusion, mistakenly thinking that this world is all in all, mistakenly thinking that I am this body, mistakenly thinking illusory pleasure is real happiness.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the illusory nature of material existence and the suffering caused by identifying with the body and seeking happiness in the material world.
